ke4GXcB0.title: Effect of White Radish Extract on Nonalcoholic Fatty Liver Diseases in SD Rats
ke4GXcB0.abstract: In order to exploit the medicinal value of white radish,the effect of white radish extract on the amelioration of nonalcoholic fatty liver diseases in SD rats was explored.The white radish extract was prepared with a rotary evaporator.The rats in model group were treated with fat emulsion with white radish extract by gavage at the doses of 0.3,1 mL/kg and 3 mL/kg.The pathological characteristics of liver tissues in rats with 8 weeks experiments were analyzed.Meanwhile,serum lipid and lipid peroxidases were determined.The results indicated that white radish extract at a high dose could significantly decrease the levels of serum TG and MDA and increase the levels of GSH in male rats.Moreover,white radish extract could alleviate the accumulation of lipid in the hepatocytes of male rats.However,no obvious change of these parameters in female rats was observed.Therefore,white radish extract can ameliorate nonalcoholic fatty liver diseases in SD male rats by decreasing the level of lipid peroxidation.

1fYZrktI.title: Study on the Fresh-keeping of Strawberry with Extracts from Rhizoma imperatae and Forsythia
1fYZrktI.abstract: In this experiment,used extracts from Rhizoma imperatae and Forsythia as preservative,compared with the common preservative's as CK,the effect on the preservation of strawberry fruit,and measured indicators were studied,which included corruption rate,weight loss,vitamin C change,sugar content,titratable acidity,red pigment preservation,anti-oxidative changes,and experiment lasted 11 days.The results showed that with used extracts from Rhizoma imperatae and Forsythia,it slowed down the corruption rate,and reduced the consumption of nutrients significantly,the cold water extract of Rhizoma imperatae could keep the quality of strawberry best during storage.

tQjwogdK.title: A MicroRNA-Based Gene Silencing Vector Construction Method in Tomato
tQjwogdK.abstract: A microRNA-baesd method for easy and rapid construction of tomato miRNA vector was described.The plasmid PRS300 which contained the miR319 aprecursor was used as the temple,the overlapping PCR amplification for the miR1917 whose target gene was LeCTR1 which were key negative regulators of ethylene responses was processed,and the reconstructed precursor was successfully transformed to the expression vector pGreen0029-35s.The transgenic plants were successfully obtained by the leaf disc method mediated by Agrobacterium tumefaciens C58.This method could provide a theoretical basis for the miRNA mechanisms of action research in tomato.

mliH381H.title: Extraction of Isothiocyanate from Radish Sprout
mliH381H.abstract: Total content of MTBITC and sulforaphene was considered as a parameter to evaluate extract efficiency,extraction technology of isothiocyanate from radish sprout was carried out using n-hexane and dichloromethane being extraction solvent.The optimal extraction conditions were: enzymolysis for 3 min,a liquid/solid ratio of 2 mL/g,an extraction time of 3-5 min,and n-hexane,dichloromethane,dichloromethane being extract order in turn.

AX7w4ki5.title: Preliminary Study on the Influence of Cadmium Stress on Chlamidomonas reinhardtii Using Noninvasive Micro-test Technique
AX7w4ki5.abstract: Based on the scanning ion-selective electrode technique,the research of Cd stress on Chlamydomonas reinhardtii was developed.The results of the experiments showed as follows:the Cd2+ fluxes of CC-124 mt wild type strain were reduced after continuous stress by 10 μg/L and 100 μg/L Cadmium,which was caused by the previous stress but not change the capacity of Cd2+ reduction.The Cd2+ fluxes of CC-400 mt mutant were not changed after previous stress.The Ca2+、H+ fluxes of both strains were not obvious,and continuous stress did not cause any fluxes.The situation was the same after adding higher concentration of Cd into the medium.The exchange of Cd2+with Ca2+ and H+ was not strong in the surface of algae cell.Using the fluxes data the adsorption model was made.Compared with other models,this model used the data from real time detection and the experiments did no harm to algal cells.

c9QjuJmA.title: Sculpting the maturation, softening and ethylene pathway: the influences of microRNAs on tomato fruits.
c9QjuJmA.abstract: MicroRNAs (miRNAs), a ubiquitous class of short RNAs, play vital roles in physiological and biochemical processes in plants by mediating gene silencing at post-transcriptional (PTGS) level. Tomato is a model system to study molecular basis of fleshy fruit ripening and senescence, ethylene biosynthesis and signal transduction owing to its genetic and molecular tractability. To study the functions of miRNAs in tomato fruit ripening and senescence, and their possible roles in ethylene response, the next generation sequencing method was employed to identify miRNAs in tomato fruit. Bioinformatics and molecular biology approaches were combined to profile the miRNAs expression patterns at three different fruit ripening stages and by exogenous ethylene treatment.In addition to 7 novel miRNA families, 103 conserved miRNAs belonging to 24 families and 10 non-conserved miRNAs matching 9 families were identified in our libraries. The targets of many these miRNAs were predicted to be transcriptional factors. Other targets are known to play roles in the regulation of metabolic processes. Interestingly, some targets were predicted to be involved in fruit ripening and softening, such as Pectate Lyase, beta-galactosidase, while a few others were predicted to be involved in ethylene biosynthesis and signaling pathway, such as ACS, EIN2 and CTR1. The expression patterns of a number of such miRNAs at three ripening stages were confirmed by stem-loop RT-PCR, which showed a strong negative correlation with that of their targets. The regulation of exogenous ethylene on miRNAs expression profiles were analyzed simultaneously, and 3 down-regulated, 5 up-regulated miRNAs were found in this study.A combination of high throughput sequencing and molecular biology approaches was used to explore the involvement of miRNAs during fruit ripening. Several miRNAs showed differential expression profiles during fruit ripening, and a number of miRNAs were influenced by ethylene treatment. The results suggest the importance of miRNAs in fruit ripening and ethylene response.

7SGJZTum.title: Effect of Temperature Fluctuations on Strawberry Quality of Storage and Shelf Life
7SGJZTum.abstract: Effect of temperature fluctuations on strawberry quality is researched by comparing "Hongyan" strawberry stored under different environment,such as constant temperature storage and fluctuant temperature storage.The results show that strawberry has worse quality stored under fluctuate temperature than stored under constant temperature after 24 h storage and 12 h shelf life respectively.Temperature fluctuations bring bad influence to strawberry quality.

8vYhG6VD.title: Fatty acid composition and antioxidant activity of 8 kinds of radish seed oil
8vYhG6VD.abstract: The radish seed oils rich in isothiocyanate were extracted with dichloromethane from eight kinds of radish seeds.The fatty acid composition,sulforaphene content and antioxidant activity of the oils were analyzed.The results showed that the oil yield was 34.65%-37.91%,and there were many fatty acids in the oils and the main fatty acid were mustard acid(29.45%-35.01%),oleic acid(21.99%-29.59%),linoleic acid(9.53%-13.63%),eicosadienoic acid(8.88%-10.52%),linolenic acid(5.30%-8.35%),palmitic acid(5.37%-5.92%),and the unsaturated fatty acid was 88.08%-89.73%.The sulforaphene content in the oils was 28.39-114.73 mg/kg,and that of the Baiyuchun radish seed oil was the highest,the sulforaphene content in the spring radish seed oils were higher than that of the autumn radish seed oils.In the test of FRAP,the Shengfeng radish seed oil showed the highest antioxidant activity.

6H3EDnJR.title: Virus-induced gene silencing in eggplant (Solanum melongena).
6H3EDnJR.abstract: Eggplant (Solanum melongena) is an economically important vegetable requiring investigation into its various genomic functions. The current limitation in the investigation of genomic function in eggplant is the lack of effective tools available for conducting functional assays. Virus-induced gene silencing (VIGS) has played a critical role in the functional genetic analyses. In this paper, TRV-mediated VIGS was successfully elicited in eggplant. We first cloned the CDS sequence of PDS (PHYTOENE DESATURASE) in eggplant and then silenced the PDS gene. Photo-bleaching was shown on the newly-developed leaves four weeks after agroinoculation, indicating that VIGS can be used to silence genes in eggplant. To further illustrate the reliability of VIGS in eggplant, we selected Chl H, Su and CLA1 as reporters to elicit VIGS using the high-pressure spray method. Suppression of Chl H and Su led to yellow leaves, while the depletion of CLA1 resulted in albino. In conclusion, four genes, PDS, Chl H, Su (Sulfur), CLA1, were down-regulated significantly by VIGS, indicating that the VIGS system can be successfully applied in eggplant and is a reliable tool for the study of gene function.

79jXGIAv.title: The research of CD4~+ CD25~+ regulation T cells and related cytokines in peripheral blood in acute ITP children
79jXGIAv.abstract: Objective To investigate the amount of CD4+CD25+ regulation T cells and the levels of related cytokines in peripheral blood in acute ITP children,and to analyze the relationships between CD4+ CD25+ regulation T cells and the immunopathogenesis of AITP.Methods The amout of CD4+ CD25+ regulation T cells was detected by flow cytometry in peripheral blood from acute ITP children and health children.Besides,related cytokines in peripheral blood were assayed by ELISA.The relation between CD4+ CD25+ regulation T cells and their related cytokines were analyzed.Results CD4+ CD25+ regulation T cells were decreased obviously in peripheral blood in acute ITP children compared with control group [(2.83±1.05)% vs(5.07±0.59)%,P<0.05].The levels of related cytokines were also decreased in AITP group compared with control [IL-10:(29.48±13.69)vs(43.10±14.95)pg/ml;TGF-β1:(170.04±91.58)vs(254.75±130.41)pg/ml,P<0.05].There are positive correlations between CD4+ CD25+ regulation T cells and related cytokine IL-10,TGF-β in acute ITP children(r1=0.54,r2=0.66,P<0.05),respectively.Conclusion The decrease of CD4+ CD25+ regulation T cells and related cytokines in peripheral blood in acute ITP children may be connected with cellular immumty disturbance of acute ITP.

JCPwYqzz.title: Distribution of Rh blood group antibodies in thalassemia children with massive transfusion and its clinical significance
JCPwYqzz.abstract: Objective:To study the Rh blood group antibody detection rate and distribution characteristics in the peripheral blood of thalassemia children with massive transfusion, and analyze the clinical significance of Rh blood group antibodies and generating rules. Method:Screening of irregular red cell blood group antibodies were detected by the micro-column gel anti-globulin technique, the Rh blood group antibodies were identified using monoclonal anti-D, anti-C, anti-c, anti-E, anti-e and red cell Rh blood group antigen, to confirm the accuracy of antibody. Antibody titers, Ig types and 37 ℃ reactivity test were assayed to clarify its clinical significance.Result:A total of 238 thalassemia children cases were detected. Rh blood group antibodies were positive in 11 cases, which detection rate was 4.6%. The specificity of antibodies were 6 cases of anti-E (54.5%), 3 of anti-D (27.3% ), 1 of anti-cE (9.1%), 1 of anti-C (9.1%), and 11 cases of Rh blood group antibodies of IgG or IgG + IgM class, which antibody titers were between 16 and 128.Conclusion:The detection rate of Rh blood group antibodies in thalassemia children was higher than that of general population. In the positive cases of the Rh blood group antibodies, anti-E accounted for an absolute majority, and the production of antibodies was positively correlated with the number of blood transfusion.

FpR5tB2D.title: Changes of CD1d~((hi))CD5~+CD19~+ regulatory B cells in peripheral blood of patients with idiopathic thrombocytopenic purpura and its significance
FpR5tB2D.abstract: Objective To study the changes of regulatory B cells(Breg) subsets in peripheral blood of patients with idiopathic thrombocytopenic purpura(ITP) and related cytokines,analyze their correlation and explore the role of Breg in the pathogenesis of ITP.Methods The proportional changes of CD19+B,CD5+CD19+B and CD1d(hi)CD5+CD19+B subsets in peripheral blood were determined by flow cytometry(FCM) and the levels of IL-10 and TGF-β1 in the supernatant of culture medium of peripheral blood mononuclear cells(PBMC) were measured by ELISA in 30 patients with ITP and 30 matching healthy controls.Results Compared to normal controls,the proportions of CD19+B,CD5+CD19+B subset were increased,but the proportion of CD1d(hi)CD5+CD19+B subset was decreased,and there were statistically significant differences(P<0.05).The expression levels of IL-10 and TGF-β1 in culture medium of PBMC of ITP patients were lower than those in healthy controls(P<0.05).There was a positive correlation between the proportion of CD1d(hi)CD5+CD19+B subsets and the levels of IL-10(r=0.717,P<0.05),but there was no correlation between CD1d(hi)CD5+CD19+B subsets and the levels of TGF-β1(r=0.073,P>0.05).Conclusion The low expression of CD1d(hi)CD5+CD19+B subsets and related cytokines IL-10 may participate in the mechanism of immunoregulative dysfunction in ITP patients.

SFAcmfss.title: Study of the Ralationship of HDN and the Different Blood Types Between Mother and Baby
SFAcmfss.abstract: Objective To investigate the relationship between O、A and B blood type of newborn and blood group antibody titer in pregnant women and to clear the influence of the antibody's level and the hemolytic disease of newborn (HDN).Methods Detect 413 pregnant woman's blood type antibody IgG who is O positive with a A or B husband.After been born,ABO blood groups,coomb's test,free antibody and antibody release test were done for those 69 babies who were in high risks of HDN, so that we would understand the relationship between the level of blood type antibody IgG of O type pregnant women and HDN.Results The percent of anti-A(B) IgG titer ≥64 in the 413 women was 61.7%.The titer was different between A or B group babies' mothers and O group babies' mothers.The difference was remarkable.The titer was identical in mothers who had A or B babies.There were 25 babies suffered from HDN in those 69 who had high risk, the percent was 36.2%.The ratio of HDN was concern with the titer of mothers' IgG,the higher the titer was the higher the ratio was.Conclusion The babies' blood type affected the level of anti-A(B)IgG of the mothers when they were different but weather baby was A or B had no direct relationships with the level of the antibody.There was a positive relationship between the level of blood type antibody IgG of O type pregnant women and hemolytic disease of newborn (HDN).

sGfIxfYx.title: Cross-matched Test in the Platelet Transfusion Refractoriness
sGfIxfYx.abstract: Objective To analyze the effect of cross-matched test in the platelet transfusion refractoriness(PTR).Methods SEPSA was used to examine blood platelet related antibody in 85 patients who were repeatedly transfused blood over 5 times(including at least 2 times of platelet),the effect of platelet transfusion after cross-matched transfusion was observed.Results There were 15 cases of PTR in 85 patients(17.65%),9(60%)were found positive of platelet antibody,and 6(66.67%)were successfully cross-matched.Conclusion Platelet antibodies lead to PTR directly,and cross-matched transfusion can enhance the effect of platelet transfusion.

KqR9vnx9.title: Analysis on the Factors Affecting Red Blood Cell Transfusions
KqR9vnx9.abstract: Objective To analyze the reasons of red blood cell invalid transfusions,provide evidence for safe and effective transfusions.Methods Review and analysis on the invalid blood transfusions in six months in Shenzhen Second People′s Hospital was done.Results The invalid red blood cell transfusions were unrelated with gender and ages,but affected by the number of previously transfusions(one pregnancy was counted as a blood transfusion),the storage time and red blood cell product category.Conclusion Minimizing the number of transfusions,the correct selection of fresh red blood cell products can reduce transfusion inefficiency.

80Fj2o90.title: Study on the Relationship between Leukocyte Removal Transfusion and FNHTR in Thalassemia
80Fj2o90.abstract: Objective To evaluate the application of leukocyte removal filter in clinical blood transfusion. Methods The 3 ml blood samples were taken before and after filtering respectively.Relative parameters,such as leukocytes,red blood cells and hemoglobin were counted by a blood counter.Relative parameters of donor's blood were compared before and after leukocyte removal filter.Meanwhile,398 cases of thalassemia children were transfused with leukocytes non-removed blood as control group,645 thalassemia children were transfused with leukocytes removed blood as observational group.The recipients were monitored for FNHTR for two days.Results The removal rate of leukocyte was 97.9% after filter.The recovery rate of red blood cell was 99.0%,but there was no significant change in hematoglobin level(P>0.05). FNHTR rate of control group was 21.8% and that of observational group was 0.8%.There was significant difference between the two groups(P<0.01).Conclusion Leukocyte removal filter can effectively remove leukocytes from blood and prevent the FNHTR.
keywords: Leukocyte Leukocyte removal filter Removal of leukocyte FNHTR

feyQ1beY.title: Factors in erythrocyte recovery following allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation
feyQ1beY.abstract: Objective To investigate various factors influencing erythrocyte recovery following allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation(Allo-HSCT).Methods A retrospective study was performed to investigate factors including schemes of transplantation,HLA-matched or mismatched,ABO-incompatible or compatible,the relationship of the patient and donor that influenced erythrocyte recovery following ALIo-HSCT.Results Major ABO-incompatible and the relationship of the patient and donor influenced the erythrocyte recovery.Conclusion The erythrocyte recovery is slower in patients with major ABO-incompatible transplantation and unrelated bone marrow transplantation.

SepYw1la.title: The research of peripheral blood regulatory T cell in patients with idiopathic thrombocytopenic purpura
SepYw1la.abstract: Objective To investigate the change of peripheral blood CD4+CD25+ regulatory T cells(Tr)in patients with idiopathic thrombocytopenic purpura(ITP),and to analyze its role in the pathogenesis of ITP.Methods Anticoagulated venous blood was collected from ITP patients(ITP group,n=35)and healthy controls(healthy control group,n=35).T lymphocytes were isolated and purified with human CD3+ T cell enrichment columm.The percentage of peripheral blood CD4+CD25+ regulatory T cells was detected by immunofluorescence staining(PE-anti-CD4 monoclone antibody and FITC-CD25 monoclone antibody)and bicolor flow cytometry by CD25/CD4 gating.Results The number and constituent ratio of CD4+CD25+T cell were significantly lower in ITP group than those of healthy control group(P<0.05).Conclusion There is peripheral blood celluar immunological function disorder in ITP patients,and decrease of CD4+CD25+ T cell population may be involved in the pathogenesis of ITP.

FDHtDAp8.title: Examination of blood group serology in patients with autoimmune hemolytic anemia
FDHtDAp8.abstract: Objective To explore effect of autoantibody on identification of ABO and RhD blood group in patients with autoimmune hemolytic anemia(AIHA).Methods The blood samples of 23 patients with AIHA were identified by routine typing and typing after chloroquine elution test on DIANA auto instrument.Direct and indirect antiglobulin test were done in the same time.Results Thirteen cases of ABO blood group were difficultly typed,all were AB.The blood group of these cases were typed correctly by chloroquine elution test.All direct antiglobulin test were positive and higher frequency of the positive results in indirect antiglobulin test appeared in the cases those ABO blood group difficultly typed.There were no RhD(-) patient in the 23 cases.Conclusion Blood group identification of patients with AIHA can be interefered by autoantibody,and the correct typing for blood group of these patients may be determined by using combination of several methods to ensure safe transfusion.

aPIrmIvq.title: Regulation research on globin peptide imbalance in children with severe β-thalassemia
aPIrmIvq.abstract: Objective To detect mRNA expression levels of globin peptide α,βandγin the peripheral blood of children with severe β-thalassemia, and analyze the relationship between miR-144 gene and the changes of globin ratio.Methods The early red blood cells were isolated from children with severe β-thalassemia and in vitro cultured, and changes of the ratio of α ,β and γ mRNA were detected by quantitative RT-PCR for β thalassemia group,miR-144 gene transfection group and the healthy control group, 72 hours after the transfection of eukaryotic expression plasmids PmiR-144-luc into the isolated early red blood cells.Results Compared with the healthy control group, the ratios of globin α/β,α/β+γ and γ/β+γ mRNA in peripheral blood of children with severe β thalassemia were elevated, with statistical significance. Compared with β thalassemia control group, the ratios of α/β and α/β+γ mRNA in gene transfection group were reduced, with statistical difference, but the ratio of γ/β+γ mRNA was not with any statistical difference.Conclusion miR-144 might take part in the regulation of the ratio of α ,β and γ globin gene expression in children with severe β-thalassemia, and this finding might provide a new experimental basis for gene regulation treatment of severe β-thalassemia.

g2NDLigG.title: Clinical Significance of Screening of Rh-negative Blood Group and Detection of Irregular Antibody
g2NDLigG.abstract: Objective To choose the matching blood to Rh-negative patients who were positive for irregular antibody by the screening of Rh-negative blood group and the detection of irregular antibody,and analyze its clinical significance.Methods A total of 363 RhD-negative patients were subjected to antibody screening and Rh blood grouping by micro-column agglutination method,based on which the Rh factor-matched blood was selected for transfusion.For lack of matched blood source,the RhD-negative patients with anti-c and anti-e antibodies were transfused with erythrocytes group O of ccdEE and CCdee phenotypes.Results Of the 363 RhD-negative patients,21 were positive for irregular antibody,including 5 for anti-D,8 for anti-E,3 for anti-c,2 for anti-c and E,2 for anti-C and 1 for anti-e.The patients with irregular antibodies were transfused with selected Rh factor-matched blood,and satisfactory clinical efficacy was observed.Conclusion By transfusion with Rh factor-matched blood selected based on antibody screening and Rh blood grouping,the production of irregular antibodies was avoided,the efficacy of clinical blood transfusion was improved,and the adverse reactions of blood transfusion was reduced.

zCjeJjcF.title: Detection of irregular antibodies by micro column gel in clinical blood transfusion
zCjeJjcF.abstract: Objective:To study the difference of detectable rate between single and mixed cells and the feasibility of the palsma replacing serum in antibody screening test.Methods:The irregular antibodies in 4857 samples were detected with Coombs'test,and the positive rate was observed.Serum and plasma samples were compared to make sure if the two groups had the same result.The mixed cells were used to detect the samples which were positive to observe the consequence.Results:8 cases were positive by screening and the positive rate was 0.16%.3 cases were pregnant women,3 cases were Mediterranean anemia and 2 cases were blood disease.There was no difference in serum and plasma samples,the same results were in single and mixed cells.Conclusion:Detecting the irregular antibodies by micro column gel in clinicl blood transfusion can effectively decrease the hemolytic transfusion raaction and mixed cells can reduce the cost.Plasma in superior to serum in antibody screening test. waTdKFFr.title: Quality comparison of red blood cells suspension with filtering of white blood cells at different times
waTdKFFr.abstract: Objective To investigate the changes of the quality of red blood cells(RBC) suspension with filtering of white blood cells(WBC) before and after storage to provide a reference for clinic to select the time for filtering of WBC.Methods 20 bags of suspension of RBC(2U for each bag),saved for 5 days at 4 ℃,filtered out WBC with filters used in department of blood transfusion,were enrolled as group A.20 bags of RBC suspension(2U for each bag),without storage and being filtered out WBC in Blood Center,were enrolled as group B.Blood samples of group A and B were detected for blood cells and the levels of inflammatory cytokines,and cultured for bacterial detection,at the 7th,14th,28th,21st and 35th day after WBC were filtered.Results In group B,the concentration of free hemoglobin(FHb) and K+ increased at the 14th and 21st day,and gradually increased with the extension of storage time(P<0.05).In group A,the levels of inflammatory cytokines,including interleukin-1,interleukin-6,interleukin-8 and tumor necrosis factor-α,increased at the 21st day,and had statistical difference,when being compared with group B(P<0.05).There was no significant difference between A and B groups for recovery rate(P>0.05).Conclusion Filtering of WBC,whether before or after storage,could both have fine filtering efficiency,but different filtering ways might have variant effects on the quality of RBC suspension,which could provide experimental base for the selection of RBC suspension filtered out WBC.

SDLQ67N4.title: Relationship between the concentration of nitric oxide in stored red blood cells and effect of transfusion
SDLQ67N4.abstract: Objective To analyze the relationship between the concentrations of nitric oxide(NO) in stored red blood cells and the transfusion effect.Methods The storage life of 535 cases of red blood cells suspension liquid respectively were 2 days of 40,7 days of 120,14 days of 235,28 days of 105 and 34 days of 35,which were respectively transfused to 266 patients,and the effectiveness of blood transfusion was analyzed.The concentrations of NO in different shelf storages of red blood cells were assayed by NO fluorescence probe,and the clinical effect of blood transfusion was compared.Results With the increment of the shelf life of red blood cells,the concentrations of NO continued to decline(P<0.01) and the efficiency of transfusion also reduced(χ2 =17.41,P<0.01).Conclusion With the extension of shelf life,the concentration of nitric oxide in stored red blood cells might decrease significantly,which could directly impact on clinical transfusion efficient.

9fnMCqhL.abstract: Objective To extend the medical equipment quality control through out the basic units of the PLA army, and meanwhile to research the new mode which is suitable for the medical equipment quality control in the basic medicine units. Methods We put forward at the first time that a new medical equipment quality control system in the basic army medicine units could be set up by the three-level equipment servicing station of a military area. The quality control work could also be done under the help of them. Results The modularization and large scale of the medical equipment quality control system in army could be formed and this could avoid the manpower and material wasting. Conclusion The scientific design of medical equipment quality control guarantees the technical support of our hospital in high level.

BzC6FiLm.title: The Development of the Portable Intelligent Real Time Activity Measurement Device
BzC6FiLm.abstract: As an important part of Human activity the body movement is related to the health and the dicease status of human beings.There have been many ways to evaluate the body activity.We have demonstrated a new theory that the absolute value of the body acceleration integrated to time is related linearly to the body energy expenditure.Based on this theory a device has been developed to measure the body energy expenditure in the case of field activity.A new integrated acceleration sensor was introduced in this device in order to measure the acceleration signal accurately.The integrated signal is feed into a PIC computer and processed,then the activity amount result is displayed and stored.This device is portable,intelligent and works by batteries.It has wide applicaton value.

COw1lC6r.title: The network security of digital hospital
COw1lC6r.abstract: Modern hospitals have the most advanced equipments and the information of the image data is connected and stored by PACS system.Along with HIS system it makes the hospital's medical and management information digitalized,stored,transmitted and processed.Highly digitalization causes high risk of network security .Computer viruses,data losing and system collapse affect the running of digital hospital.How to guarantee the network security for a digital hospital is the most important subject which is needed to be solved in time.

0N2yhiY5.abstract: Along with the development of medical system many hospitals have reached to the high digital level.Modern hospitals have the most advanced equipments and the information of the image data is connected and stored by PACS system.Along with HIS system it makes the hospital′s medical and management information digitalized,stored,transmitted and processed.Highly digitalization causes high risk of network security problems.Computer viruses,data losing and system collapse affect the running of digital hospital.How to keep the network security problems away from digital hospital is the most important subject which is needed to be solved in time.

Ys3QL2td.title: Some thoughts on assembling procurement of medical equipment
Ys3QL2td.abstract: Objective: Medical equipment has become the necessary carrier for creating economic and social benefits. Methods: This article discusses the definition and significance of assembling procurement of medical equipment ,and analysis several important aspects in the assembling procurement process(research and demonstration, parameter setting, qualification examination, business negotiation, installation and acceptance, etc). Results: Through continuous improvement for the process, so that the assembling procurement of medical equipment to standardize purchasing behavior. Conclusion: To reduce the purchase price is important for ensuring quality of medical equipment.

5h6zZ9Da.abstract: There are lots of special equipment used by hospitals.The quality and price of them are various.The competition among the vendors is also severity.The public bidding for the medical equipment,the hospital construction subject and other materials should be introduced in order to standardize the medical equipment purchasing program,decrease the price and ensure the quality.This paper discusses the important steps of the medical equipment public bidding.

5913VN52.abstract: The new-generation 3.0T MRI system has strong magnet field and high magnet precision.It needs very serious conditions for the circumstance and shield device.In order to make the whole MRI system work in a normal state,a normative site preparation and installation procession standard is necessary.The installation elements,such as the site,the device room,the shield,the conditioner,the illumination and the ground connection,are explained and summarized.Then a set of entire site preparation and installation procedure standard for 3.0T MRI is put forward.

1SRHslx9.title: Study on automatic test technique for electrocardiograph
1SRHslx9.abstract: Objective:As to the problems about man-switched test signals,man-measured waveform shapes,man-calculated output errors during the procedures of electrocardiograph measurement,the automatic testing techniques were carefully designed.Methods:The production and control of testing signals,the collection and processing of electrocardiograph data,and the automatic switching techniques about work state of electrocardiograph were seriously studied,so the main hardware and basic software of automatic measurements technique were set up.Results:Automatic test technique could finish all the basic parameters of electrocardiograph.Conclusion:These problems of time-consuming,human-consuming,and paper-consuming are expectedly solved in the future.

83wWIh13.title: Zero-line Automatic Calibration and Application for the Intelligent Medical Instrument
83wWIh13.abstract: The intelligent level of the modern medical equipments is higher than before and the automatic calibration circuits are largely used. The control circuit of the intelligent equipments is quite complicated and its working modes have been simplified to four-terminal or double terminal nets. The intelligent medical equipments such as CT, MRI, DR, PET/ CT have more chances to have some "soft" errors that are usually related to the zero-line calibration. In actual use, it can be noticed and performed, and the detecting and servicing for the medical equipments can be much easier than before.

lLXieW2T.title: Comparative study of the biological characteristics of two human ovarian carcinoma models in nude mice
lLXieW2T.abstract: Objective:To establish intraperitoneal(IP) injection model and subcutaneous(SC) injection model of human ovarian carcinoma in nude mice and compare their biological characteristics.Methods:The cell suspension derived from A2780/DDP were injected intraperitoneally or subcutaneously in nude mice to establish human epithelial ovarian carcinoma models,and their growth behavior and biological characteristics were observed.Distribution of cell cycles were analyzed by flow cytometry(FCM).Expression of LHRH-R were investigated by immunohistochemistry.Results:The human ovarian carcinoma models were established successfully.The success rate of transplantation in both groups were 100%.The median survival time lengths in IP group and SC group were 30.000±1.095 days and 41.000±0.894 days,respectively.FCM analysis showed the distribution of cell cycles of xenografted tumors in two groups were the same as those of A2780/DDP cells.Histology and electron microscopy showed the same characteristics and morphological properties in the two groups,and immunohistochemistry staining of LHRH-R were both positive.Conclusion:Human ovarian carcinoma models in nude mice are easy to establish.And the IP model may be an ideal model for treatment research of ovarian carcinoma as it simulates the intraperitoneally dessiminating behavior of human ovarian carcinoma in the patients.

XGMw9839.title: Effect of ultrasound mediated LHRHa Carrying microbubbles destruction on the concentration of Cisplatin(DDP) in ovarian cancer cell A2780/DDP
XGMw9839.abstract: Objective:To investigate the effects of the ultrasound combine with LHRHa-bound liposome microbubles(LHRHa-LM) in intracellur Cisplatin(DDP)concentration. Method:The human ovarian cancer cell line A2780/DDP was divided into 5 groups: control group,DDP group,DDP and ultrasound radiation group,DDP and LM plus ultrasound radiation group,and DDP and LHRHa-LM plus ultrasound radiation group.High Performance Liquid Chromatography(HPLC) was used to detect intracellular drug concentration at 12h,24h,48h after treatment for every group.Flow Cytometry(FCM) test was used to detect the cytomembrane permeability to propidine iodide(PI) instantly,12h,24h after liposome microbubles(LM)combined ultrasound irradiation in vitro A2780/DDP cell.Result: cytomembrane permeability to PI has increased instantly after treatment,and decreaced over time.DDP concentration is in linear dependence,R is 0.9994.DDP and LHRHa-LM plus ultrasound group demonstrated the most obvious increasing of intracellular drug concentration on 12h,24h after treatment.Conclusion: LHRHa-LM plus ultrasound could increase permeability of cell membrane more markedly than other groups,so to increase the intracellular chemotherapy drug concentration,and the rate of drug increasing may slower over time,that may be related to reversible increasing of cytomembrane permeability caused by LM plus ultrasound.

1QkDuVWj.title: Preparation and quality evaluation of LHRHa-targeted Brucea javanica oil liposomes
1QkDuVWj.abstract: Objective To prepare luteinizing hormone-releasing hormone a(LHRHa) targeted Brucea javanica liposomes and evaluate its quality.Methods e LHRHa-targeted Brucea javanica liposome was prepared by thin layer dispersion together with biotinstreptavidin bridge method.The optimum formation was selected by means of orthogonal design of experiment.The morphology of liposome was observed with transmission electron microscope.Zetasizer Nano ZS analyzer was used to measure the particle size and zeta potential.e entrapment e ciency was determined by ultra-violet spectroscopy and column chromatography.Centrifugal acceleration experiment and determination of leak rate were performed to prove the liposome stability.e targeting ability of liposome was appraised by cell experiment in vitro.Results e formed optimum formula was as follows: the ratio of lecithin to cholesterol was 4:1,Brucea javanica oil:lipid was 3:10,DSPE-PEG(2000)-Biotin:lecithin content was 3%,ultrasonic-homogenized for 8 minutes.Liposomes were round in shape,the average diameter and zeta potential of liposome were 155.1±14.5mm and –(24.1±0.54) mV,respectively.The average entrapment e ciency was 92.2%.Binding capacity with the A2780/DDP cell line in the LHRHa-targeted liposomes was 2.7 times higher than that in the non-targeting liposomes.Conclusion e technique of preparing LHRHa-targeted Brucea javanica liposome is suitable,and high in entrapment e ciency,with good stability and targeting ability.

bf0mkLo2.title: Preparation of LHRHa-Paclitaxel liposomes and its anti-tumor effect in vitro
bf0mkLo2.abstract: Objective: To prepare LHRHa-Paclitaxel liposomes and to observe its inhibitory effect on ovarian cancer A2780/DDP cells in vitro.Methods:Paclitaxel liposomes(PTX-Lipo) and LHRHa-Paclitaxel liposomes(LHRHa-PTX-Lipo) were prepared by means of film ultrasound and their morphology was examined with transmission electron microscope.The encapsulation rates of PTX-Lipo and LHRHa-PTX-Lipo were quantified with high-performance liquid chromatography(HPLC).The cellular intake of NBD-Lipo and LHRHa-NBD-Lipo was embodied through detecting the intake of NBD fluorescein by ovarian cancer A2780/DDP cells with laser confocal microscope.The inhibitory effect of LHRHa-PTX-Lipo on ovarian cancer cells in vitro was measured by MTT assay and colony-forming assay.Results:The mean diameter of LHRHa-PTX-Lipo particles was 123.4 nm with encapsulation rate being above 90%.The fluorescein intake of A2780/DDP cells was higher in NBD-LHRHa-Lipo group compared with that in NBD-Lipo group.The inhibitory effect of LHRHa-PTX-Lipo on the growth and clone formation of A2780/DDP cell was much more intense than that of PTX and PTX-Lipo(P<0.05).Conclusion: LHRHa-PTX-Lipo prepared by means of film ultrasound could aggregate drugs at targeted site thus increase the inhibitory effect of drugs on ovarian cancer cells in vitro.

6Cjl2qyL.title: Ultrasound-mediated destruction of paclitaxel and oxygen loaded lipid microbubbles for combination therapy in ovarian cancer xenografts.
6Cjl2qyL.abstract: We have synthesized multifunctional oxygen and paclitaxel loaded microbubbles (OPLMBs) for ultrasound mediated delivery of combination therapy in an ovarian cancer xenograft model. In comparison with other therapeutic options, intravenous injection of OPLMBs followed by ultrasound mediation yielded a superior therapeutic outcome. Immunohistochemical analyses of the dissected tumor tissue confirmed the increased tumor apoptosis and the reduced VEGF expression after treatment. Western Blot tests further confirmed the decreased expressions of HIF-1α and P-gp. Our experiment suggests that ultrasound mediation of OPLMBs may provide a promising drug delivery strategy for the combination treatment of ovarian cancer.

w6DLY7n3.title: Causes of the Prolonged Second Stage of Labor and the High Risk Factors of Neonatal Asphyxia
w6DLY7n3.abstract: Objective:To investigate the causes of prolonged second stage of labor and the high risk factors of neonatal asphyxia.Methods:All of the cases with prolonged second stage of labor in our hospital from Jan 2002 to Jan 2008 were retrospectively reviewed.Results:The total cases of prolonged second stage of labor were 133 and the incidence was 2.07%.The four major causes were abnormal fetal position(35.34%),uterine atony(19.55%),abnormality of umbilical cord(15.04%)and abnormality of birth canal(8.27%).The incidence of neonatal asphyxia were significantly higher in the patients with fetal distress or abnormality of umbilical cord than the patients without those factors(P<0.05).The incidence of neonatal asphyxia were also higher in the patients with vaginal midwifery than the patients with cesarean section and vaginal delivery(P<0.05).The incidence of neonatal asphyxia was no difference between the patient with abnormal fetal position,uterine atony,preterm delivery,pregnant complication,fetal gender and the patients without those factors(P>0.05).Conclusions:The major causes of prolonged second stage of labor are abnormal fetal position,uterine atony,abnormality of umbilical cord and abnormality of birth canal.The high risk factors of the neonatal asphyxia after the prolonged second stage of labor include fetal distress,abnor-mality of umbilical cord and vaginal midewifery.

d9Hq43Rd.title: Impact of different treatment time in gestational diabetes mellitus on maternal and neonatal outcomes
d9Hq43Rd.abstract: Objective To investigate the impact of different treatment time in women with gestational diabetes mellitus on maternal and neonatal outcomes.Methods Data of 78 women with GDM from January 2001 to December 2006 were reviewed.51 GDM women had been treated before 34 gestational weeks and the rest 27 GDM women hadn′t.The impact on maternal and neonatal outcomes were compared between the two groups.Results In the earlier treated group the incidence of hypertensive disorder complicating pregnancy,hydramnios,wound infection,premature infant,neonatal asphyxia,fetal macrosomia,were 15.69%,7.84%,5.88%,13.73%,7.84%,19.61%,respectively.It was much lower as compared with the later treated group,37.04%,29.63%,25.93%,33.33%,11.11%,22.22%,respectively.Conclusion Gestational diabetes mellitus does great harm to mother and infant.Diagnosing GDM and controlling blood glucose as early as possible can decrease the complications of mother and infant.

1rf9k418.title: Impact of different blood glucose levels in gestational diabetes mellitus on maternal and neonatal outcomes
1rf9k418.abstract: Objective:To evaluate the impact of different glucose levels in women with gestational diabetes mellitus on maternal and neonatal outcomes.Methods:Data of 65 pregnant women with GDM admitted in our hospital from January 2001 to October 2006 were reviewed.A total of 46 GDM women had blood glucose levels under control before delivery and the rest 19 GDM women did not.The impact of different glucose levels on maternal and neonatal outcomes were compared between the two groups.Results:In the group with the glucose level uncontrolled,the incidence of hypertensive disorder complicating pregnancy,premature rupture of membrane,hydramnios,postpartum hemorrhage,premature infant,neonatal asphyxia,fetal macrosomia,and therapy after 34 weeks pregnancy were 42.11%,26.32%,31.58%,21.05%,47.37%,15.79%,36.84%,and 57.89%,respectively.compared with those of the group with glucose level controlled as 15.22%,4.35%,6.52%,2.17%,17.39%,0.00%,10.87%,and 28.26%,respectively.All the rates of the uncontrolled group were markedly higher than those of the controlled group.Conclusion:Gestational diabetes mellitus does great harm to mother and infant.Diagnosing GDM and controlling blood glucose as early as possible can decrease the complications of mother and infant.

SLg126bJ.title: Dual-mode imaging and therapeutic effects of drug-loaded phase-transition nanoparticles combined with near-infrared laser and low-intensity ultrasound on ovarian cancer.
SLg126bJ.abstract: Chemotherapy and photo-sonodynamic therapy (PSDT) can be combined through drug delivery nano-platforms to enhance the anti-tumor efficacy, however, which is limited by hypoxia in tumor, thereby causing chemotherapy resistance. Perfluoropentane (PFP) has the ability to carry oxygen and to enhance ultrasound or photoacoustic imaging after vaporization. Herein, we constructed a kind of nanoparticles (PTX/ICG and oxygen loaded PLGA nanoparticles (PIO_NPs)), which had PFP core carrying oxygen and PLGA shell loaded indocyanine green (ICG) and paclitaxel (PTX). PIO_NPs harbored good optical stability and the ability to transit phase. Moreover, it could rapidly release PTX and generate ROS under the mediation by near-infrared laser and low-intensity ultrasound. The PIO_NPs enhanced contrast of the ultrasound and PA imaging. In particular, PIO_NPs may be used to monitor and guide treatment for the accumulation of PIO_NPs at tumor site can be observed by PA imaging. Compared with PTX or other nanoparticles, PIO_NPs combined with laser and ultrasound (L.U) significantly induced apoptosis of SKOV3 cells and inhibited SKOV3 tumor growth. Therefore, PIO_NPs are of great potential in cancer imaging and therapy.

wxflTBiS.title: Enhanced therapeutic efficacy of LHRHa-targeted brucea javanica oil liposomes for ovarian cancer
wxflTBiS.abstract: BackgroundAlthough brucea javanica oil liposomes (BJOLs) have been used clinically to treat ovarian cancer, its clinical efficacy is often limited by systemic side effects due to non-specific distribution. Luteinizing hormone releasing hormone receptor (LHRHR) is overexpressed in most ovarian cancers but negligibly expressed in most of the other visceral organs. In this study, we aimed to develop a novel LHRHa targeted and BJO-loaded liposomes (LHRHa-BJOLs), and investigate its characteristics, targeting ability and anti-ovarian cancer efficiency both in vitro and in vivo.

gmPJivPO.title: Ultrasound-mediated destruction of oxygen and paclitaxel loaded dual-targeting microbubbles for intraperitoneal treatment of ovarian cancer xenografts.
gmPJivPO.abstract: Abstract   Folate receptor (FR) is overexpressed in many epithelial cancers and tumor-associated macrophages (TAMs), which enable it to function as an appropriate target for cancer treatment. We have successfully synthesized multifunctional folate-targeted and oxygen/paclitaxel loaded microbubbles (TOPLMBs) for ultrasound (US) mediated delivery for combination therapy in an intraperitoneal ovarian cancer xenograft model. The TOPLMBs target both ovarian cancer cells and TAMs and provide a promising drug delivery strategy for the combination treatment of ovarian cancer and tumor microenvironment. Microscopic imaging and flow cytometric analysis showed that TOPLMBs significantly penetrated into ovarian cancer cells and tumor-associated macrophages (TAMs) within tumor ascites fluid and the tumor nodules. sjKZfgeL.title: Effect and safety of levoamlodipine maleate tablets on patients with mild-to-moderate hypertension
sjKZfgeL.abstract: AIM To evaluate the effect and safety of levoamlodipine maleate on patients with mild-to-moderate hypertension.METHODS Forty-four patients with mild-to-moderate hypertension were randomized to test group(2.5-5 mg·d-1 of levoamlodipine maleate for 8 wk) or control group(5-10 mg·d-1 of amlodipine besylate for 8 wk).The blood pressure,heart rate,blood routine,urine routine,fasting plasma glucose,liver function,and renal function were detected.RESULTS The average diastolic blood pressure of patients in the test group and in the control group declined from(98.48±5.13)mm Hg to(83.28±5.58)mm Hg and(99.18±5.23)mm Hg to(83.19±5.79)mm Hg,respectively(P<0.01);the average systolic blood pressure of patients in the test group and in the control group declined from(156.26±9.81)mm Hg to(131.50±8.75)mm Hg and(158.23±10.15)mm Hg to(131.74±7.79)mm Hg,respectively(P<0.01);The blood pressure,heart rate,blood routine,urine routine,fasting plasma glucose,liver function,and renal function between 2 groups had no significant differences.CONCLUSION Levoamlodipine maleate had the same effect and safety on patients with mild-to-moderate hypertension as amlodipine besylate.

mtfVfEIu.title: Relationship between coronary artery calcification and coronary artery stenosis
mtfVfEIu.abstract: Objective To investigate the relationship between coronary artery calcification and coronary artery stenosis. Methods Fifty-four (male:36,female:18) hospitalized patients with coronary artery disease were enrolled in this study. The average age of the patients was 68.47±9.35 years old (52～84 years old). All the patients underwent sixteen-slice spiral computed tomography for calculating the coronary calcification score (CCS). The calcification scores of the total coronary artery and of each of the sixteen coronary artery segments were compared with the severity of the extend of the stenosis of the related coronary artery. We also analyzed relationship of total CCS with the age of our patients. Results Total CCS had a positive relationship with age (r=0.372,P=0.009) and the severity of the stenosis of some segments of the coronary arteries (RA: r =0.499,P<0.01; LAD: r =0.431,P<0.01; D1: r =0.440,P<0.01; LCX: r =0.469,P<0.01). The CCS of RA,LM and LCX correlated positively with the stenosis severity respectively. Conclusions Total CCS had a positive relationship with age,suggesting the incidence of coronary artery calcification increase with age. CCS correlated positively with the severity of the stenosis of only some of the coronary arteries and these stenosis are all at the proximal segments of the three main branches.

LZPffPA7.title: <TITLE>EFFICACY AND SAFETY OF HAZZAR IN ELDERLY HYPERTENSION
LZPffPA7.abstract: objective Routine therapeutic dosage has more side effects in elderly due to the hepatic and renal dysfunction. We aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of Hazzar on blood pressure, influence on serum uric acid, serum potassium, renal function and side effects. methods 63 elderly patients(over 80 years old) and 54 patients(between 65~79 years old) were administered with once-daily hazzar for at least four weeks. Blood pressure, serum uric acid, serum potassium and serum creatinine were checked before and after 4 weeks' therapy. results After 4 weeks’ therapy, there was a significant descent on blood pressure in both groups compared to treatment before, but not on serum uric acid, serum potassium and serum creatinine. There were no significant side effects in both groups. conclusions Hazzar can decrease blood pressure effectively but not excessively in elderly patients, has low influence on serum potassium, serum uric acid and renal function.

iSHJ3Lgs.title: Clinical value of sixteen-slides spiral CT in the evaluation of coronary artery disease.
iSHJ3Lgs.abstract: Objective:The aim of this study was to evaluate the value of sixteen-slides spiral computed tomography angiography (CTA) for the assessment of coronary artery disease. Methods:Both sixteen-slide spiral CTA and conventional coronary angiography (CAG) were performed in 40 patients who were suspected of having coronary artery disease. Results: Among 76 main coronary artery lesions detected by CTA, 67 were confirmed by CAG. There were 75 mormal main coronary artery shown by both CTA and CAG. Therefore, the sensitivity, specificity, positive predictive value, and negative predictive value of CTA were 84. 8%,89. 3% , 88. 2%,and 86. 2%, respectively. Conclusions:This study suggests that non-invasive coronary angiography with sixteen-slides spiral computed tomography may be used as a reliable diagnostic tool for coronary artery disease.

ZX9Yo5cm.title: Relationship between bilirubin lipids and coronary artery disease
ZX9Yo5cm.abstract: Objective To evaluate the relationship between blood lipids or/and serum bilirubin and coronary heart disease.Methods Between July 2005 and May 2006,57 inpatients(31 males and 26 females) diagnosed to have coronary heart disease with coronary arteriography,and the group was separated into 3 subgroup,by the number of injured coronary arteries;Another 67 patients(37 males and 30 females) were taken as controls,they were proved with no coronary disease.The total cholesterol(TC),high density lipoprotein cholesterol(HDL-C),low density lipoprotein cholesterol(LDL-C),bilirubin were detected.The analysis of variance was used to compare the means among the groups.Results There were obvious differences in TBIL、DBIL、IBIL、TC/TBIL、HDL-C、LDL-C、TC/(HDL-C+TBIL) and LDL-C/(HDL-C+TBIL) among the 2 groups(P <0.05~0.01).Conclusions The decreased total bilirubin and increased LDL、LDL/(HDL+TBIL) and TC/(HDL+TBIL) are related to coronary heart disease.

MmyOYU3I.title: Use of intravenous amiodarone for emergency conversion of paroxysmal atrial fibrillation in elderly patients
MmyOYU3I.abstract: Objective To evaluate effectiveness and safety of using intravenous amiodarone for emergency conversion of paroxysmal atrial fibrillation(AF)in elderly patients.Methods 34 patients(≥60 years old)with paroxysmal AF,and 22 patients(<60 years old)as control were both injected with amiodarone under electrocardiographic monitoring in the emergency room,and then conversion characteristics and adverse reactions were recorded.Results The AF conversion rate was 73.5% in the study group,and 81.8% in the control group.No significant adverse reaction occurred in both groups.Conclusions In the emergency department,intravenous administration of amiodarone under electrocardiographic monitoring can convert paroxysmal AF successfully in elderly patients and has insignificant adverse reactions.

OgyrSSTi.title: Preliminary clinical analysis of chronic heart failure and insulin resistance in the elderly
OgyrSSTi.abstract: Objective To evaluate the influence of different degrees of chronic heart failure on insulin resistance in elderly patients. Methods 33 non diabetic elderly patients with different degrees of chronic heart failure were divided into two groups according to the NYHA functional class. Fasting serum glucose and insulin were measured. HOMA-IR and QUICKI were calculated in two groups. Results Fasting insulin and HOMA-IR were parallel with aggravation of heart failure (P<0.05), and QUICKI decreased with aggravation of heart failure (P<0.05). Conclusions Insulin resistance is affected by chronic heart failure, and aggravates with the progression of heart failure.

5erspkxH.title: Correlation between serum adiponectin and severity of coronary artery disease in the elderly
5erspkxH.abstract: Objective To investigate the correlation between serum adiponectin and severity of coronary artery disease. Methods A total of 142 subjects aged 65 years or more who attended the cardiovascular department of shanghai Huadong Hospital from May 2005 to Dec 2006 were enrolled. The subjects were divided into normal control group and CAD group by angiography. CAD group was sub-grouped into single-vessel,double-vessel and triple-vessel groups. Gensini score was also calculated. Serum concentrations of adiponctin were evaluated by sandwich ELISA system. Results Serum adiponectin concentration of CAD group was significantly lower than that of control group,but there was no significant difference among the three CAD subgroups or among the groups with different gensini scores. Conclusions Serum adiponectin is associated with coronary artery disease in the elderly,but seems to be insignificantly associated with the severity.

HwTj9Zfb.title: The Serum Visfatin Level in Coronary Artery Disease Patients and Its Relationship to Coronary Artery Disease
HwTj9Zfb.abstract: Objective: The main purpose of this study was to investigate the serum visfatin level in coronary artery disease patients and its relationship to cardiovascular disease(CAD) risk factors.Methods: A total of 129 subjects were enrolled and all the coronary angiography were performed in Shanghai Huadong Hospital.Among of the in 96 coronary artery disease patients who had more than 50% coronary stenosis were further divided into three groups.ST-elevation myocardial infarction(STEMI),unstable angina/non-ST-elevation myocardial infarction(UA/NSTEMI) and stable angina pectoris(SAP) while the other 33 patients whose coronary stenosis was less than 50% were enrolled into control group.Serum visfatin level was evaluated.Moreover,cholesterol,triacylglyceride,high density lipoprotein,low density lipoprotein,apolipoprotein B100,apolipoprotein A,Lipoprotein(a),fasting serum glucose and creatinine were also detected.Results: The average serum visfatin concentration in three CAD groups and control group was shown as follow: STEMI group>UA/NSTEMI group>SAP group>control group(26.96±5.30ng/dL vs.24.20±6.88 ng·dL-1 vs.20.84±4.63 ng·dL-1 vs.19.85±8.08 ng·dL-1).Serum visfatin level in STEMI group and UA/NSTEMI group was significant higher than that in SAP group(P<0.01) and control group(P<0.05).In addition,Correction analysis shows serum visfatin concentration is related to fasting serum glucose,however,not associated with other CAD risk factors.Logistic stepwise regression analysis showed that increasing serum visfatin level was independently associated with CAD.Conclusions: The increasing serum visfatin level is independently related to coronary artery disease.

ExHxIsGF.title: Relationship between carotid artery atherosclerosis and coronary artert disease
ExHxIsGF.abstract: Objective:To observe the relationship between intima-media thickness and carotid artery plaque in coronary heart disease. Methods:101 patients who had been examined by coronary angiography were divided into normal group (52 patients) and coronary artery disease group(49 patients). Carotid ultrasonography was performed in them. Results:In coronary disease group, the average IMT was (0.91±0.13)mm , the average IMCSA was (22.13±3.21)mm2. In normal group, the average IMT was (0.84±0.06)mm , the average IMCSA was (18.06±1.15)mm2, the difference was significative in statistics. In coronary disease group, carotid artery plague was found in 63.7% of the patients,but it was found in only 34.6% patients in normal group(P<0.01). To predict coronary disease, if IMT 0.845mm was served as a separating criterion,the sensitivity was 68.8%, the speciality was 67.3%; if IMCSA 19mm2 was served as a separating criterion, the the sensitivity was 87.5%,the speciality was 84.6%. Conclusion:Carotid ultrasonography could be used to predict the present coronary heart disease.

e63VUFf3.title: Correlation between cardiac function classification and serum uric acid levels
e63VUFf3.abstract: Objective:To explore the association of cardiac function classification and serum uric acid level. Methods:A total of 161 patients with heart disease were divided into Ⅰ,Ⅱ,Ⅲ and Ⅳ groups by NYHA cardiac function classification. Serum uric acid level and left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) were determined. The association of serum uric acid level and LVEF was analyzed,and the serum uric acid levels of different groups were compared. Results:The serum uric acid levels ofⅠ,Ⅱ,Ⅲ and Ⅳ groups were (269.26 ± 71.32),(321.29 ± 76.10),(474.15 ± 89.06) and (603.91±148.59)μmol/L respectively,the levels of serum uric acid among different groups were significantly different (P<0.05),serum uric acid level was positively correlated with cardiac function classification,the total serum uric acid level was negatively correlated with LVEF (rs=-0.68,P<0.01). Conclusion:Serum uric acid level was positively correlated with cardiac function classification.

ky21OuC0.title: Clinical evaluation of the vessel suture device in elderly patients receiving percutaneous coronary intervention
ky21OuC0.abstract: Objective To evaluate the efficacy and safety of the vessel suture device in elderly patients who underwent percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI). Methods 331 patients who used the vessel suture device in PCI through the femoral artery were divided into the elderly group (≥65 years with a mean of 74.0±5.1 years) and the control group (<65 years with a mean of 55.4±5.8 years).The success rate of using the device and the incidence of vascular complications of the two groups were analyzed and compared. Results The overall success rate was 93.7% (310/331). The success rate in the elderly group was 91.9% (194/211) and that in the control group was 96.7% (116/120). The difference between the two groups was insignificant (P>0.05). Conclusions The vessel suture device is safe and able to prevent hemorrhagic complications effectively in elderly PCI patients,thus worthy of being further spread in elderly PCI patients.

AsEH9V8v.title: The Association of Serum Interleukin-18 Levels and Coronary Artery Disease in Elders
AsEH9V8v.abstract: Objective:To evaluate the relations between concentrations of serum IL-18 and coronary artery disease(CAD) in elders.Methods:Serum IL-18 concentrations were measured by sandwich enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay(ELISA).22 pa- tients with stable angina pectoris(SAP),20 with unstable angina pectoris (UAP),10 with acute myocardial infarction (AM1) and 14 patients without CAD were studied.We investigate the difference of serum IL-18 concentrations among the groups.Re- sults:The levels of serum IL-18 in patients with CAD were significantly higher than those without CAD.Serum concentrations of IL-18 were significantly increased in the unstable angina and AMI group in comparison with the stable angina and control group (P＜0.01).There was no difference of IL-18 level between the patients with unstable angina and AMI.Conclusion:The serum IL-18 level can reflect acceleration of atherosclerotic plaques.High serum 11718 concentration means deterioration of CAD.

p2OvRqay.title: Correlation between Lp (a) and acute coronary syndrome
p2OvRqay.abstract: Objective To explore the association between Lp (a) and acute coronary syndrome (ACS). Methods Enrolled in the present study were 38 cases of NCHD, 28 cases of SAP, 38 cases of AMI and 46 cases of UAP. Serum concentrations of Lp (a) and lipids (TC and TG) were measured in each patient and compared between the groups. Results (1) Lp (a) level was significantly higher in patients with ACS compare with that in patients with NCHD (P<0.05 ) or SAP (P<0.05); (2) No correlations were observed between Lp(a) level and serum levels of total cholesterol (TC) or triglycerides (TG)(P>0.05). Conclusions Serum Lp (a) concentration may be an independent risk factor for acute coronary syndrome.

GNKiOh1v.title: Incidence rates of clopidogrel resistance and influential factors in patients with acute coronary syndrome
GNKiOh1v.abstract: AIM To observe the prevalence and probable influential factors of clopidogrel resistance(CPGR) in patients with acute coronary syndrome(ACS).METHODS One hundred patients with ACS undergoing percutaneous coronary intervention(PCI) were enrolled.Using light tiansmittance aggregometry,platelet aggregation(PA) induced by adenosine diphosphate(ADP) was measured before and 24 h after loading dose clopidogrel intake.All the patients were divided into CPGR group and clopidogrel sensitive group according to the degree of PA inhibition.The correlation between CPGR and clinical risk factors of ACS was analyzed.RESULTS Among the 100 ACS patients,23 patients(23%) were noted to be CPGR,77 patients(77%) were sensitive to clopidogrel.The baseline characteristics and concomitant drugs did not differ significantly between 2 groups,P>0.05.The baseline PA of CPGR group was distincdy lower than that of clopidogrel sensitive group.The baseline level of PA was independent predictors for developing CPGR,P<0.05. CONCLUSION Part of patients with ACS undergoing PCI appeared CPGR.The baseline level of PA has prognostic value of CPGR.

6In80ZUv.title: Investigation of a case of H1N1 influenza outbreak
6In80ZUv.abstract: Objective Investigation was conducted to analyze the risk factors of an outbreak of H1N1 influenza and analyze the epidemiological characteristics of the outbreak.Method The data from questionnaires were statistically analyzed.Results An outbreak of H1N1 influenza between 22nd and 29th was noted.A total of 69 cases,with the overall attack rate of 10.5%,were analyzed.The infected patients were aged 18～30 years and the average was 21-years-olds.The male to female ratio was 1:1.02.The outbreak was scattered.The attack rate of the day-shift crowd was 15.6% and the night-shift crowd was 4.7%,and the difference was significant.Cases concentrated in the white board stamping class,the attack rate was 26.2%,while the attack rate of day shift washing was only 7.6%.There was statistical significance between the differences,and with no statistical significance between the attack rate of night shift stamping class and washing class.The incidence in the line one of stamping was higher than that in the line five of stamping,were 27.6% and 26.3%,day shift stamping has obvious spatial clustering.Four samples were found positive for H1N1 influenza.Conclusion The mode of transmission was through the contact with infectious droplets and the infection was acquired in the production lines.Isolation of the source of infection is an effective measure to control the outbreak.

kXnydFrA.title: Analysis of Outbreak of Infection Disease in Baoan District Form2009 to 2012
kXnydFrA.abstract: Objective:To mastery the occur and epidemic rule of infections outbreak in baoan direct,evaluation the effects of prevention and control of the infectious diseases,analysis the epidemic factors and study the strategies of prevention and control of the infectious diseases in new situation.Methods:Use descriptive epidemiology method to analysis the epidemic characteristics of infections outbreak in Baoan direct from 2009to 2012.Results:There were 134outbreaks from 2009to 2012,the incidence case was 3 159and the total attack rate was 2.91%.The outbreak distributed in 9 street scenes,in these streets Xingan,Xixiang and shajing streets account for the majority.Cases mainly from march to June,September to November.The student,worker and infant account for 48.08%,41.44%and 6.49%respectively in all the cases.The attack rate of worker,student and infant were 2.12%,3.59%and 6.35%respectively.Conclusion: Student and worker were the high risk population of infections outbreak,the emphasis of prevention were strengthen surveillance and propaganda.

AzQyoWox.title: Epidemiological Characteristics of Infectious diarrhea other than CDTP in Baoan District of Shenzhen City from 2008-2012
AzQyoWox.abstract: [Objective]To investigate the epidemiological characteristics of infectious diarrhea other than cholera,dysentery,typhoid and paratyphoid(CDTP) in Baoan District of Shenzhen City from 2008-2012,explore relative measures for preventing and controlling infectious diarrhea other than CDTP.[Methods]All cases and outbreaks of infectious diarrhea other than CDTP occurred in Baoan District from 2008 to 2012 reported by epidemic network report system were collected,and then analyzed by a descriptive research method.[Results]49 546 cases of infectious diarrhea other than CDTP were reported in Baoan District of Shenzhen City during the period of 2008-2012,the annual case number ranged from 7 296 to 12 916,and the incidence rate showed a rising trend.The peak season was October to December.The proportions of scattered children in children cases of each year were all more than 87%,and the workers accounted for about 65% of adult cases of each year.The incidence rate in Shiyan Street was the highest(254.92 / lakh).The laboratory confirmed cases accounted for 96.3% of the total cases,and the cases of rotavirus infection accounted for 96.99% of the laboratory confirmed cases.The cases of Norovirus infection,however,resulted in the large epidemic outbreaks in Baoan District.[Conclusion]The children under 5 years old(especially the scattered children) are the high-risk group for infectious diarrhea other than CDTP in Baoan District of Shenzhen City.The peak season is autumn and winter,and rotavirus is the major pathogen for infectious diarrhea other than CDTP.

wSTfRtNa.title: Epidemiological analysis of outbreak of infectious diseases in Bao′an District of Shenzhen in 2010
wSTfRtNa.abstract: Objective To investigate epidemiological characteristics of outbreak of six infectious diseases,including cho lera,influenza,acute hemorrhagic conjunctivitis,hand-foot-and-mouth disease,varicella and mycoplasmal pnumonia in Bao'an District of Shenzhen City.Methods The epidemiological data of outbreaks of six infectious diseases was collected in Bao'an District in Shenzhen City,2010 and analyzed by descriptive study.Results Total of 24 outbreaks of infectious diseases were reported,including 1 522 cases,1 006 in men,516 in women,in 2010,with the total attack rate of 2.47%.There were 15 outbreaks of acute hemorrhagic conjunctivitis contributing to 62.50% of the outbreaks.The main outbreak diseases were enteric infectious diseases,accounting for 79.17% of the total.The peaks of the outbreaks were in March,April and September.83.33% of the outbreaks occurred in teaching places.The children and the teenagers had the high risk of the six infectious diseases.The most of the outbreaks of the six infectious diseases occurred in Xin'an Street in Bao'an District.Conclusions Control measures of the infectious disease are effective in Bao'an District.The control work of the infectious disease in Bao'an District should be focus on the enteric infectious diseases in summer and autumn,and more attention should be paid to respiratory diseases in winter and spring,especially in children and teenagers.The health education should be carried out regularly in the teachers,parents,students,workers and supervisors in factories and enterprises.

oXaWsOcs.title: Investigation Report of a Case of Imported Dengue Fever in Bao'an District of Shenzhen City
oXaWsOcs.abstract: [Objective]To determine the distribution range and epidemic trend of dengue fever in Bao'an District.[Methods]Case definition was established,the connection between the cases was analyzed by descriptive epidemiology and evaluation was made on the distribution risk.[Results]There were two cases in this epidemic situation;they were both imported from Indonesia in the same tourist party;the investigation of the 91 families around one of the infected person's house showed that there were risks of dengue fever transmission(the Breteau index were 18.68 and 6.98 respectively before and after we took mosquitocide measures).[Conclusion]This epidemic disease is proved to be imported dengue fever.

YeREhjZO.title: Research of Influenza A(H1N1)Vaccine Coverage and Its Influential Factors among Focus groups in Bao’an District, Shenzhen City
YeREhjZO.abstract: Objective:To study the influenza A(H1N1)vaccine coverage and influential factors among health-care workers and students in Bao’an district,Shenzhen city.Methods:A survey of random sampling was carried out for 1 549 students,770health-care workers and 530childcare staff with anonymous questionnaire.The 2test and Logistic regression analysis were used for the univariate analysis and multivariate analysis to evaluate the influential factors of the influenza A(H1N1)vaccine coverage.Results:The influenza A(H1N1)vaccine coverage of students and health-care workers in Bao’an district were 30.39%,55.03%,39.96%,respectively.The main unvaccinated reason of the three groups was concerning about side effects,accounting for 39.10%,36.81%,39.10%,respectively.The multivariate analysis showed that the students’age,the custodian occupation,knowing the influenza A(H1N1)vaccination time,and with a seasonal influenza A(H1N1)vaccination in the past three years were correlated with influenza A(H1N1) vaccination in students(P<0.05).Educational level,medical posts,working life,knowing the time of influenza A(H1N1)vaccination and with a seasonal influenza vaccination in the past three years were correlated with influenza A(H1N1)vaccination in health-care workers.Conclusion:The influenza A(H1N1)vaccine coverage of health-care workers in Bao’an was higher than that of students and childcare staff.It is necessary to strengthen the three groups’propaganda of influenza A(H1N1)vaccine effectiveness,security and inoculation knowledge.

i29MadB9.title: SEROLOGICAL ANALYSIS OF INFECTION ON CLONORCHIS SINENSIS OF BAOAN DISTRICT IN SHENZHEN CITY
i29MadB9.abstract: [Objective]To understand the infected status of the population infected with clonorchis sinensis in Lou village,and to provide references for clinical diagnosis,prevention and treatment.[Methods]The antibody against clonorchis sinensis in healthy population was examined by using enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay.If there were positive cases,their enteropathogen in stools continued to be tested.[Results]1 473 cases were tested and 4.75% of them were positive.4.22% positive cases were male and 5.24% female.It showed no significant difference(P﹤0.05).In addition,the positive rate of under30 years old group was 3.99%,that of 31-50 years old group was 6.9%,that of over 50 years group old was 1.95%.The positive rate of 31-50 years old was observably higher than that of the other age groups.[Conclusion]The degree of the population infected with clonorchis sinensis is a low level in Lou village.Health education should be improved to prevent infection though mouth.It's also important to launch health propaganda,serological detection and treatment of patients with clorzorchis sinensis so as to control the infection in the population.

8J4xVkj2.title: Value of precaution model of influenza based on moving percentile method
8J4xVkj2.abstract: Objective To explore the optimization alert threshold of the precaution model of influenza based on the moving percentile method.Methods The different percentiles of P were respectively adopted as the candidates of alert thresholds on the moving percentile method.Data weres analyzed based on the reported cases of influenza in Baoan district of Shenzhen from 2009 to 2011.The sensitivity and specificity of the precaution model were evaluated in different percentiles of P,and the optimization alert threshold was determined.In addition,the discrimination efficacy of precaution model was validated.Results The optimization alert threshold of precaution model was 80 percentile,where the area under the ROC curve was 0.925(95% confidence internal: 0.804 to 0.963),and the sensitivity and specificity were 91.29% and 90.31%,respectively.Further analysis showed that the better discrimination efficacy of precaution model was found(sensitivity= 77.78%,specificity=85.29%,Youden’s index=63.07%,positive predictive value=73.68%,and negative predictive value= 87.88%,respectively).Conclusion The precaution model of influenza outbreak can be,based on the moving percentile method,used for prediction of influenza outbreak and the optimization alert percentile was 80 percentile.

cjXzPW25.title: Analysis of 78 cases with severe hand-foot-mouth disease in Bao'an District, Shenzhen
cjXzPW25.abstract: Objective To improve diagnostic ability of hand-foot-mouth disease(HFMD) in primary hospital and strategies of prevention and control for severe HFMD,and reduce HFMD mortality rate by analyzing the epidemiological features and clinical symptoms of the severe HFMD cases in Bao'an District in Shenzhen City.Methods A retrospective method was applied to analyze the epidemic situation and clinical manifestations of severe HFMD cases in Bao'an District in Shenzhen City.Results A total of 78 severe HFMD cases were reported including 40 of the male and 38 of the female aged from 2 months to 7 years during 2009-2010 in Bao'an District.83.33% of the cases were children of 0-3 year-old.87.18% of them were scattered children.A total of 15 cases were reported from Guanlan Street in Bao'an District,accounting for 19.23% of the total.9 cases were dead,5 of the male and 4 of the female and under 3 years of age.A total of 3 death cases were reported from Guanlan Street,accounting for 33.33% of the total number of deaths.The severe HFMD commonly occurred in summer and autumn with peaks in June,August and November.14 of them had contact with the severe HFMD cases.48 of them were taken fecal detection,with 45 cases of the positive.89.58% cases were positive EV71.People living in the rural-urban fringe zone had more chances to suffer from the HFMD.The severe HFMD patients mostly had high fever,multiple skin rashes and multi-system damage.Conclusions The progress of severe HFMD is rapid.It is very important to detect the symptom changes of the patient and improve the diagnostic ability of primary hospital and timely treatment. We should improve the HFMD diagnostic level to reduce the mortality rate of the severe HFMD, and strengthen the health education to improve people's health consciousness.
cjXzPW25.venue: Bulletin of Disease Control and Prevention

7DRJIVKS.title: An Investigation of the Clonorchis sinensis Infection-Assocaiated Risk Factors among Household Population in Baoan District,Shenzhen City
7DRJIVKS.abstract: Objective To determine the risk factors associated with Clonorchis sinensis infection in Baoan District, so as to provide the measures for the prevention and control of infection. Method Clonorchis sinensis infection was determined by ELISA. The ratio between the infection and control subject was 1 ∶2, and the age matched (within 5 years) control subjects were living within a distance of 50 meters of the infected subjects. Result 856 subjects were examined. 32 subjects (3.74% ) were found infected with Clonorchis sinensis. Significant difference of infection was found among the various age groups. The risk factors associated with the infection included the consumption of raw or semi-cooked seafood, fresh water fishes or fresh water shrimps. Other risk factors included eating food with unwashed hands and cross-contamination of the foods with uncooked sea foods, or with the kitchen knives. Conclusion Bad personal or family hygiene is the major cause of Clonorchis sinensis infection.
